definition: variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: Time passes, we have grown up to your Liangbin already Banbai.
sentences.chinese: 岁月流逝，我们都已长大可您的两鬓却已斑白。

sentences.english: My heart has grown rich with the passing of years.
sentences.chinese: 随着岁月流逝，我的心变得丰富。

sentences.english: But all of that’s okay. I’ve adjusted my own beliefs about my self and my strengths as I go along.
sentences.chinese: 可是，岁月流逝，我调整了对自我以及能力的看法。

sentences.english: But as time passed, few ever became any qualities that I actually had.
sentences.chinese: 但是随着岁月流逝，很少特质成为我真正拥有的。

sentences.english: And who can say where the road goes?Where the day flows?
sentences.chinese: 谁能说明，道路伸向何方，岁月流逝何处？

sentences.english: Or behold the flowing years from the Sea returning?
sentences.chinese: 谁能见，岁月流逝西海何时归？

sentences.english: Have Americans simply become riskier over the years?
sentences.chinese: 随着岁月流逝，难道美国人都成为投机客了吗？

sentences.english: Time have passed so fast, all their herd were die.
sentences.chinese: 岁月流逝，所有的牛羊都已不再。

sentences.english: The rush of time， time passes.

definition: lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
lit. one's youth will never return/to make the most of one's opportunities (idiom)
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
the passage of the years/the flow of time
things have remained the same, but people have changed
